questions.question: When acknowledging mode/code setting instructions, pilots shall:
options: a. read back only the code to be set.
b. read back the mode and the code to be set.
c. use only the word ROGER.
d. use only the word WILCO.

questions.question: The pilot of an aircraft losing two-way communications shall set the SSR transponder to Mode Alpha code:
When the SSR transponder appears to be unserviceable and repair is not possible before departure, then:
options: a. the aircraft would be permitted to depart to the nearest aerodrome where repair can be carried out.
b. the pilot must indicate the failure on the flight plan after which ATC will endeavour to provide for the flight to be continued.
c. the flight can only continue in the most direct manner.
d. the pilot will not be permitted to commence the flight.

questions.question: What Mode A code shall be used to provide recognition of an aircraft emergency?
options: a. Code 7500
b. Code 7600
c. Code 7000
d. Code 7700

questions.question: Which of the following correctly lists special purpose codes that are used in conjunction with SSR?
options: a. Distress 7700; Unlawful Interference 7600; Communications failure 7500
b. Distress 7500; Unlawful Interference 7700; Communications failure 7600
c. Distress 7600; Unlawful Interference 7500; Communications failure 7700
d. Distress 7700; Unlawful Interference 7500; Communications failure 7600

questions.question: When an aircraft carries a serviceable transponder, the pilot is to operate the transponder:
options: a. only when the aircraft is flying within the airspace where SSR is used for ATC purposes.
b. only when the aircraft is flying in CAS.
c. only when direct by ATC.
d. at all times during flight regardless of whether or not the aircraft is within or outside airspace where SSR is used for ATC purposes.

questions.question: What is the transponder code for radio failure?
options: a. Mode A code 7500
b. Mode B code 7600
c. Mode A code 7700
d. Mode A code 7600
